page.title: 06Interviewing Mr. Banfield
page.content: Mr. Banfield told us something about the area. Nearly all of the parish was originally owned by the Abbots of Cerne. After the dissolution of the monasteries the owners of Shute Barton took over most of the land.There were three Manors: Philliholme, Wylde Court and the Rectorial Manor. Lord Bridport owned these until the estates broke up. The first church was dedicated by the Bishop of Crediton. Thomas Hardy, the famous author, has connections with the area. Francis Kilvert, the Wye diarist, spent childhood summers in Hawkchurch. Charles II is reputed to have sought sanctuary at Wylde Court on 22nd September 1651.
